title: The Umbrellas of Cherbourg
creator_credit: Parc Film, Madeleine Films, Beta Film, Jacques Demy, Bernard Evein, Jacqueline Moreau, Gilbert de Goldschmidt, Mag Bodard and Pierre Lazareff
brief_description: This simple romantic tragedy begins in 1957. Guy Foucher, a 20-year-old French auto mechanic, has fallen in love with 17-year-old Geneviève Emery, an employee in her widowed mother’s chic but financially embattled umbrella shop.

constellations_other.name: All about Agnes
constellations_other.description: Belgian director Agnes Varda was the only female director in the French New Wave movement and is known for her long career across influential documentary and dramas, and for her trademark humour, curiosity and insight.

creator_credit_for_label: Parc Film, Madeleine Films, Beta Film, Jacques Demy, Bernard Evein, Jacqueline Moreau, Gilbert de Goldschmidt, Mag Bodard and Pierre Lazareff
description: This simple romantic tragedy begins in 1957. Guy Foucher, a 20-year-old French auto mechanic, has fallen in love with 17-year-old Geneviève Emery, an employee in her widowed mother’s chic but financially embattled umbrella shop. On the evening before Guy is to leave for a two-year tour of combat in Algeria, he and Geneviève make love. She becomes pregnant and must choose between waiting for Guy’s return or accepting an offer of marriage from a wealthy diamond merchant.

Guy Foucher, a 20-year-old French auto mechanic, has fallen in love with 17-year-old Geneviève Emery, an employee in her widowed mother’s chic but financially embattled umbrella shop. On the evening before Guy is to leave for a two-year tour of combat in Algeria, he and Geneviève make love. She becomes pregnant and must choose between waiting for Guy’s return or accepting an offer of marriage from a wealthy diamond merchant.
